intro: Chrysanthemum haematomma, commonly known as the blood chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dark red to purple flowers, which resemble small marigolds. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Chrysanthemum haematomma is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
